KPK Panggil Dua Saksi Terkait TPPU Mantan Panitera PN Jakut
06 Nov 2019, 11:40 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Panggil Dua Saksi Terkait TPPU Mantan Panitera PN Jakut

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan (KPK) hari ini kembali memanggil sejumlah saksi terkait kasus perkara dugaan gratifikasi dan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (TPPU) yang menjerat mantan panitera Pengadilan Negeri (PN) Jakarta Utara (Jakut).
Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan di Jakarta menjelaskan penyidik KPK dijadwalkan memanggil saksi panitera PN Sampit Mohammad Teguh dan juga wakil panitera PN Palembang Iwan Sarjana Puspa sebagai saksi dalam kasus ini.
"KPK dijadwalkan memanggil  2 orang dalam kapasitasnya sebagai saksi untuk tersangka R (Rohadi)," kata Febri di Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Febri menjelaskan bahwa penyidik KPK juga memanggil dua orang saksi lainnya dalam kasus ini, masing-masing Sekretaris Pengadilan Negeri (PN) Palembang Rudi Indawan dan Direktur PT Asia Strategic Mining Corporation (ASMC) Ismet Nuroni.
Sementara itu tersangka Rohadi sebelumnya diketahui merupakan mantan panitera Pengadilan Negeri (PN) Jakarta Utara. Rohadi telah dihukum 7 tahun penjara karena dinyatakan telah bersalah terbukti menerima suap terkait penanganan kasus perkara di pengadilan. 
Majelis hakim menyatakan bahwa terdakwa Rohadi terbukti secara sah dan meyakinkan dinyatakan bersalah menerima suap senilai Rp 300 juta. Menurut hakim, pembaerian uang itu terkait penanganan perkara tersebut. 
Menurut majelis hakim, uang suap  sebesar Rp 50 juta itu untuk pengurusan majelis hakim dan Rp 250 juta sisanya untuk mengatur agar artis atau penyanyi dangdut Saipul Jamil divonis ringan oleh majelis hakim PN Jakarta Utara.
Sementara itu dalam kasus lain  tersangka Rohadi juga dijerat penyidik KPK dengan sangkaan melakukan tidak pidana penerimaan suap atau gratifikasi dan juga kasus pencucian uang atau TPPU.

KPK Calls Two Witnesses Regarding TPPU Former Registrar of North Jakarta District Court
06 Nov 2019, 11:40 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Calls Two Witnesses Regarding TPPU Former Registrar of North Jakarta District Court

KBRN, Jakarta: Investigators of the Eradication Commission (KPK) today summoned a number of witnesses related to cases of alleged gratuity and Corruption (TPPU) which ensnared former North Jakarta District Court (North Jakarta) District Court clerk.
KPK Head of Public Relations, Febri Diansyah, told reporters in Jakarta that KPK investigators were scheduled to summon witnesses to the Sampit PN PN clerk Mohammad Teguh and also Palembang PN deputy registrar Iwan Sarjana Puspa as witnesses in this case.
"The KPK is scheduled to summon 2 people in its capacity as witnesses to suspect R (Rohadi)," Febri said in Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Febri explained that KPK investigators also summoned two other witnesses in this case, respectively Palembang District Court Secretary (PN) Rudi Indawan and PT Asia Strategic Mining Corporation (ASMC) Director Ismet Nuroni.
Meanwhile the suspect Rohadi was previously known to be a former clerk of the North Jakarta District Court. Rohadi has been sentenced to 7 years in prison for being found guilty of accepting bribes related to handling cases in court.
The panel of judges stated that the defendant Rohadi was legally and convincingly proven guilty of accepting bribes worth Rp 300 million. According to the judge, the payment of the money was related to the handling of the case.
According to the panel of judges, the Rp 50 million bribe was for the management of the panel of judges and the remaining Rp 250 million was to arrange for dangdut artist or singer Saipul Jamil to be sentenced lightly by the North Jakarta District Court judges.
Meanwhile, in another case, the suspect Rohadi was also snared by KPK investigators on suspicion of committing no criminal acceptance of bribery or gratuity and also a case of money laundering or TPPU.
